page.title: 09W.WILTS SAILING ASSOCIATION
page.content: A popular leisure facility in Westbury in 1985 is a young persons' Sailing Association which sails on a lake near the railway station and trains children between ages of 6 and 16 to sail safely. There are 16 boats in use, mostly Topper dinghies and a rescue boat with an outboard motor which has a speed of over 30 knots. In June 1985 the membership was 14 students and 5 instructors, the subscription was Â£3.50 per year plus 35p per session for use of boat, life jacket and personal insurance. Sailing is on Thursdays & Fridays from 6pm to dusk. On Sundays the club races are held; all sailing members have to rig and de-rig their own boats and there is compulsory practice in 'Man overboard' and 'capsize' emergency drills. The lake is an old ironstone minehole between 1 and 2 metres deep.
